TypeSignature.Value: public class RangePartitionResolver<T> : Microsoft.Azure.Documents.Client.IPartitionResolver where T : IComparable<T>, IEquatable<T>

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RangePartitionResolver`1<(class System.IComparable`1<!T>, class System.IEquatable`1<!T>) T> extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.Azure.Documents.Client.IPartitionResolver

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Support for IPartitionResolver based classes is now obsolete. It's recommended that you use partitioned collections for higher storage and throughput.")

Docs.typeparam: The type of value to use for range partitioning.
Docs.summary: RangePartitionResolver implements partitioning in Azure DocumentDB database service by using a partition map of ranges of values to a collection self-link. This works well when the data is naturally ordered and commonly queried upon using ranges of values, e.g., for time series data or alphabetical ranges of strings.

remarks.para: Support for IPartitionResolver based classes is now obsolete. It's recommended that you use Partitioned Collections for higher storage and throughput.

In range partitioning, partitions are assigned based on whether the partition key is within a certain range. The RangePartitionResolver class helps you maintain a mapping between a and collection self-link.

is a simple class for specifying ranges of any types that implement and like strings or numbers. For reads and creates, you can pass in any arbitrary range, and the resolver identifies all the candidate collections by identifying the ranges of the partitions that intersect twith the requested range.

A special case of range partitioning is when the range is just a single discrete value, sometimes called Lookup Partitioning. This is commonly used for partitioning by discrete values like Region or Type or for partitioning tenants in a multi-tenant application.

Docs.summary: Extracts the partition key from the specified document using the specified property or function in order of preference in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.returns: object used as the partition key.
Docs.exception: Thrown if unable to extract the partition key.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string ResolveForCreate(object partitionKey) cil managed

Docs.param: The partition key used to determine the target collection for create
Docs.summary: Given a partition key, returns the correct collection self-link for creating a document using the range partition map in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.returns: The target collection link that will be used for document creation.
Docs.remarks: If multiple ranges match the specified partitionKey, then the resolver returns one of the matching ranges. If none of the ranges match, then the method throws a . If partitionKey is null, then all collections are returned.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the is an invalid type or if none of the ranges match the specified partition key.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> ResolveForRead(object partitionKey) cil managed

Docs.param: The partition key used to determine the target collections for query
Docs.summary: Given a partition key, returns a list of collection links to read from using the range partition map in the Azure DocumentDB database service.
Docs.returns: The list of target collection links.
Docs.remarks: The must be an instance of , or an ."/>. This method returns all the collections corresponding to the ranges that intersect with the specified .
Docs.exception: Thrown if the is an invalid type.
